description: '''Zydeco''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|z|aɪ|d|ɪ|ˌ|k|oʊ|,_|-|d|iː|-}} {{respell|ZY|dih|koh|,_|-|dee|-}}; {{langx|fr|zarico}}) is a [[music genre]] that was created in rural [[Southwest Louisiana]] by French-speaking [[African Americans|Afro-Americans]] of [[Creoles of color|Creole]] heritage. It blends African and Caribbean rhythms, [[blues]], and [[rhythm and blues]] with music indigenous to the [[Louisiana Creoles]], such as [[Music of Louisiana#Southern region (Traditional Genres)|la la]] and [[Music of Louisiana#Southern region (Traditional Genres)|juré]]. The main instruments are [[accordion]] and [[Washboard (musical instrument)|washboard]] (also called rubboard or scrubboard, sometimes made expressly for musical use as a [[vest frottoir]]).
